close_symbols: enum MHD_ProcRecvDataStage (all enumerators: MHD_PROC_RECV_INIT, MHD_PROC_RECV_METHOD, MHD_PROC_RECV_URI, MHD_PROC_RECV_HTTPVER, MHD_PROC_RECV_HEADERS, MHD_PROC_RECV_COOKIE, MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_NORMAL, MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_CHUNKED, MHD_PROC_RECV_FOOTERS)

struct MHD_Connection::state (MHD_CONNECTION_* values: MHD_CONNECTION_FULL_REQ_RECEIVED, MHD_CONNECTION_INIT, MHD_CONNECTION_REQ_LINE_RECEIVING, MHD_CONNECTION_REQ_HEADERS_RECEIVING, MHD_CONNECTION_BODY_RECEIVING, MHD_CONNECTION_FOOTERS_RECEIVING)
struct MHD_Connection::rq (fields: have_chunked_upload, http_mthd, http_ver, some_payload_processed, current_chunk_offset, current_chunk_size)
enum/http method/version constants: MHD_HTTP_MTHD_NO_METHOD, MHD_HTTP_MTHD_GET, MHD_HTTP_MTHD_DELETE, MHD_HTTP_VER_UNKNOWN
transmit_error_response_static / transmit_error_response_len (function) and its return/side‑effect semantics
explanation: To determine whether any statements in handle_recv_no_space are provably unreachable you must know: (1) the complete enumerated domain of stage (MHD_ProcRecvDataStage) and whether the switch covers all possible enumerators (otherwise the default / end-of-function mhd_assert(0) might be reachable); (2) the semantic relationship between stage values and connection state used in the mhd_asserts — i.e. the MHD_CONNECTION_* constants and the layout/meaning of c->state — because several assertions constrain which switch cases can legitimately occur; (3) the shape and runtime contents of struct MHD_Connection (rq subfields, read_buffer/read_buffer_offset and daemon) because internal if/else branches depend on rq.have_chunked_upload, rq.http_mthd/http_ver, rq.some_payload_processed and current_chunk_* values; (4) the HTTP method/version constants used in the heuristic check (MHD_HTTP_MTHD_NO_METHOD, MHD_HTTP_MTHD_GET, MHD_HTTP_MTHD_DELETE, MHD_HTTP_VER_UNKNOWN) to determine whether the URI/HTTPVER branch can take the transmit_error_response_static path or the connection_close_error path; (5) the definitions/semantic effects of mhd_assert and MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (they may be no-ops, aborting, or have side effects) because assertions can be compiled out or can terminate execution and thus affect reachability; (6) the behavior (and possible noreturn semantics) of all callees invoked from each branch (connection_close_error, transmit_error_response_static/transmit_error_response_len, handle_req_headers_no_space, has_unprocessed_upload_body_data_in_buffer, handle_req_chunk_size_line_no_space, handle_req_footers_no_space) to know whether control returns to the caller or not — if a callee does not return then subsequent code is unreachable by construction. Each listed symbol is therefore required to decide if any case/block in handle_recv_no_space can never be executed and hence constitutes unreachable code under the MISRA rule.
